name: Rarefied Words
description: 30 exceptional words for the true wordsmith

words.definition: A word created from the initials of other words.
examples: 'Radar' is an abecedism from radio detection.
Acronyms are a type of abecedism.

words.definition: Composed of both good and evil.
The warmth of the sun in winter.
examples: She enjoyed the apricity on cold days.
Apricity made the winter walk pleasant.

words.definition: Concise or condensed expression; brevity of diction.
examples: Her brachylogy made the message clear.

words.definition: Incorrect pronunciation.
examples: His cacoepy of foreign words was noticeable.

words.definition: An urge to do something inadvisable.
examples: He had a cacoethes for gambling.

words.definition: Relating to the underworld; subterranean.
A state of unease or generalized dissatisfaction.
examples: She experienced dysphoria about her career.

words.definition: Relating to charity; charitable.
A state of happiness and well-being; human flourishing.
examples: Aristotle defined the good life as eudaimonia.

words.definition: The action of estimating something as worthless.
examples: His floccinaucinihilipilification of art was extreme.
The longest non-technical word involves floccinaucinihilipilification.

words.definition: Tending to produce laughter.
examples: The comedian's gelogenic material was popular.

words.definition: The causation of disease by medical treatment.
Physical or intellectual pleasure, delight, or ecstasy.
Government by the worst or least qualified people.
Thinking of the perfect reply too late; staircase wit.
examples: She suffered from l'esprit de l'escalier.
The perfect comeback came as l'esprit de l'escalier.

words.definition: Having a keen sense of smell.
examples: Her macrosmatic ability detected the perfume.

words.definition: Sadness or depression after waking from a pleasant dream.
A misheard word or phrase that creates a new meaning.
examples: 'Scuse me while I kiss this guy' is a mondegreen.

words.definition: The pleasure of anticipating success.
examples: The nikhedonia was almost better than winning.

words.definition: Contemplation of one's navel; useless speculation.
The act of stretching and yawning.
examples: Morning pandiculation helps wake the body.
She completed her pandiculation before rising.

words.definition: Petty or trivial; quibbling over details.
examples: The pettifogging lawyer annoyed the judge.
Stop pettifogging and address the main issue.

words.definition: A knockout blow, either physically or figuratively.
Soundness of mind; prudence and self-control.
A petty lie; pretentious nonsense.
examples: His excuse was just a taradiddle.

words.definition: A person in tattered clothing; a ragamuffin.
Loathsome or dreadful.
examples: The ugsome sight made her shudder.

words.definition: The act of traveling as a stranger.
examples: His xenization through Asia changed him.

words.definition: Relating to the vulva or vagina; symbolizing female generative power.
examples: Yonic imagery appears in many cultures.
